ETYMOLOGY: From Anglo-Norman and Old French jureor ('one who takes an oath'), from jurer ('to swear'), from Latin iurāre ('to swear, take an oath').

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A noun is a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A member of a jury; a person sworn to give a verdict in a legal case on the basis of evidence submitted to them in court.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 陪审团成员；被宣誓根据法庭上提交的证据对案件做出裁决的人。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The twelve jurors deliberated for hours before reaching a verdict.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 十二名陪审员经过数小时的讨论才达成判决。
